titleInfo.title: What You Need to Know and Do to Truly Leave No Child Behind

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This action guide describes how the Bush budget brings good news to the rich, bad news to the poor, defies the prophets and the gospels, and mocks American values of fair play and opportunity. It analyzes the Bush administration's budget war on children and steps you can take to protect and invest rather than hurt children. Part I outlines our investment choices as a nation. Part II outlines the key provisions of the comprehensive Dodd-Miller Act to Leave No Child Behind (which the CDF Action Council supports), important victories to date, and how it differs from the Bush administration's No Child Left Behind Act. Part III describes the gap between the Bush administration's compassionate words and uncompassionate deeds for children. Part IV provides state-by-state tables on child poverty, child health coverage, and state spending per public school pupil and per priosoner. The Appendix lists a few resources to help you and key action dates.
